Sentencas: Recent developments on decreasing the operating temperature for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) have enabled the use of high-temperature ferritic alloys as interconnect materials.
Titulo: Interfacial Shear Strength of Oxide Scale and SS 441 Substrate

Sentencas: Oxide scale will inevitably grow on the ferritic interconnects in a high-temperature oxidation environment of SOFCs.
Titulo: Interfacial Shear Strength of Oxide Scale and SS 441 Substrate

Sentencas: The growth of the oxide scale induces growth stresses in the scale layer and on the scale/substrate interface.
Titulo: Interfacial Shear Strength of Oxide Scale and SS 441 Substrate

Sentencas: These growth stresses combined with the thermal stresses induced after stacking cooling by the thermal expansion coefficient mismatch between the oxide scale and the substrate may lead to scale delamination/buckling and eventual spallation, which may lead to serious cell performance degradation.
Titulo: Interfacial Shear Strength of Oxide Scale and SS 441 Substrate

Sentencas: Hence, the interfacial adhesion strength between the oxide scale and the substrate is crucial to the reliability and durability of the metallic interconnect in SOFC operating environments.
Titulo: Interfacial Shear Strength of Oxide Scale and SS 441 Substrate

Sentencas: In this article, we applied an integrated experimental/modeling methodology to quantify the interfacial adhesion strength between the oxide scale and the SS 441 metallic interconnect.
Titulo: Interfacial Shear Strength of Oxide Scale and SS 441 Substrate

Sentencas: The predicted interfacial strength is discussed in detail.
Titulo: Interfacial Shear Strength of Oxide Scale and SS 441 Substrate
